About the Product:
Avalakki Medium is oval-shaped and has a slightly thinner texture than thick poha. This cereal is made by flattening de-husked rice. These are rigid, bland-tasting, white grains that get softer and tend to swell up to twice their size when soaked in water. It gives instant energy and is thus used in several heart-healthy traditional recipes. It is good for weight management also as it doesn't contain any cholesterol and saturated fat. It is enriched with Vitamins, carbohydrates and dietary fibre. 
Your Favourite Poha/Avalakki/Aval/Chivda now comes with Bb Royal's trust, sourced from the finest farm, prepared in hygienic and qualitative packaging to ensure safe transits.Click here for unique and delicious recipes -
https://www.bigbasket.com/flavors/collections/233/rice-rice-products/
How to Use:
Soak in water for 2-3 minutes so that they can soften. 
Drain the water before using.
It can be consumed with milk and sugar or cooked to make desserts, poha, upma.
It can also be fried to make tasty snacks.
Benefits:
It contains a good amount of complex carbohydrates and dietary fiber.
It is also a rich source of vitamin E and minerals such as calcium, iron and magnesium.
It is easily digestible and filling making it light yet satisfying meals.
Poha is light on the stomach and easy to digest.
It is a source of instant energy on account of the rice content.

About the Product:
Sabudana, also known as sago, is a starchy substance common in Indian cuisine. Derived from the pith of tropical palm trees, it's popularly consumed during religious fasting periods. Sabudana is often processed into small, pearl-like balls that turn translucent when cooked. Its mild flavour makes it a versatile ingredient, suitable for both sweet and savory dishes. Sabudana Khichdi, a spiced tapioca dish, and Sabudana Vada, a deep-fried snack, are classic examples of its use. For dessert, it's often used in puddings like Sabudana Kheer. Its unique texture and taste make it a culinary delight.

About the Product:
Aashirvaad, the brand that you trust and love, always ensures that only the best quality products reach your kitchen. Aashirvaad Svasti Pure Cow Ghee stays true to that. It has been made with love in India, going through a 4-stage stringent quality process. Aashirvaad Svasti Pure Cow Ghee is made with a special SloCook process, similar to the process of making ghee at home. In this process, the ghee is prepared by cooking slowly for about three and a half hours over gradually increased temperatures, which enhances its natural aroma. Enjoy this desi ghee, which has a rich aroma, golden granular texture, and consistent quality. Aashirvaad Svasti Pure Cow Ghee not only complements your cooking but also adds a tempting aroma to your dishes.
Features:
Aashirvaad Svasti Pure Cow Ghee is a premium ghee made with a special SloCook process. This desi ghee is prepared by slow cooking it for about 3.5 hours over gradually increased temperatures. The SloCook process gives the ghee its rich aroma, golden granular texture, and consistent quality. This rich and aromatic Aashirvaad Svasti Pure Cow Ghee naturally contains Vitamin A, which is known to support immunity. Now enhance the aroma and deliciousness of every dish with Aashirvaad Svasti Pure Cow Ghee, which is made with love in India.

About the Product:
Wheat flour is a staple and is one of the main sources of energy. It also provides a number of essential nutrients such as protein, B vitamins, and vitamin E in significant amounts, which are beneficial for health. 24 Mantra Organic Atta is made from whole wheat using the traditional chakki procedure and brings the old-world goodness of rotis into homes. Therefore, wheat flour has a significant amount of dietary fibre and phytochemicals, which deliver a lot of health benefits. Our Organic Whole Wheat Atta is 100% organic, grown without synthetic pesticides and GMOs.
Features:
100% organic, grown without synthetic pesticides, grown without synthetic GMOs, made by the traditional chakki method and is not refined, a major source of energy in our diet, a good source of protein, a good source of B vitamins and vitamin E, rich in bran which contains a significant amount of dietary fibre which is good for our gut, beneficial for those who have diabetes and high cholesterol levels in the blood.
How to Use:
Wheat flour is used in the baking of bread. Wheat is the major ingredient in most bread rolls, crackers, cookies, biscuits, cakes, doughnuts, muffins, pancakes, waffles, noodles, pie crusts, ice cream cones, macaroni, spaghetti, puddings, pizza, and many prepared hot and cold breakfast foods.

About the Product:
Rajma Chitra White, also known as white kidney beans, is a popular ingredient in various global cuisines. This type of bean is known for its creamy texture and mild flavours, making it a versatile addition to numerous dishes. Its ability to meld with diverse flavours and ingredients makes them a favourite among home cooks and professional chefs alike.

From the Brand:
About the Product
Stay in the pink of your health with GoodDiet Himalayan Pink Rock Salt. This salt comes in the form of tiny crystals, found naturally in the Himalayas and contains magnesium, potassium, required sodium, and 84 other traces of minerals that are not present in common salt. Low in sodium and high in flavour, a tiny amount of pink salt can go a long way in enhancing your dishes.
As the core ingredient, Pink Salt plays two roles - It reduces bitter flavours and makes the rest of the flavour pop and also helps to balance the pH levels in the body, flushes out toxins, keeps you hydrated at all times and improves your energy. Your table salt also undergoes a refining process that removes its impurities and any other mineral besides sodium chloride. However, BB GoodDiet's Himalayan Rock Salt comes with its own health benefits.
Ingredients:
Natural Rock Salt.
Benefits:
Helps to improve respiratory diseases.
Balances your body's pH 3.
Help reduce signs of ageing.
Helps regulate blood sugar levels.
Helps improve the quality of sleep.
An easy replacement option for your table salt that is suitable for people of all age groups.
It is very much similar to black salt powder.
It provides necessary nourishment and brings purity & taste to the table to enjoy.
How to Use:
Open the pack and add BB GoodDiet's Himalayan Pink Rock Salt (powder) to the dish according to your choice of taste.

BB Royal Organic Kabuli Channa has high fibre content, they are proper vegetarian item & hence good to fill your stomach with. Kabuli chana is believed to be one of the earliest cultivated legumes. White chickpeas are one of the most famous edible legumes of firm texture. Kabuli Channa contains got high fibre content, they are proper vegetarian stuffs and hence good to fill your stomach wif. Due to their high fibre content, regular intake of Kabuli chana may help with stomach disorders, including acid reflux, constipation, irregular bowel movements, stomach upset and gastric ulcers.

About the Product:
Whole wheat atta retains more nutrients and dietary fibre compared to refined wheat flour. Whole wheat atta has a slightly coarse texture and a nutty flavour due to the presence of bran and germ. It is commonly used in Indian cuisine to make chapatis (flatbreads), rotis, parathas, and other baked goods. Whole wheat atta is valued for its higher nutritional content and is preferred by those looking for healthier alternatives to refined flour.
How to Use:
It can be used for making chapattis, puri, paratha, kulcha, katchori, cake, cookies etc.To make roti add oil, salt and water as required and knead into a smooth soft dough.Make a small to medium ball and flatten it out and start roalling it in a flat circle.Put in on hot tava and cook on both sides. Once ready serve it hot with dal or any veggie dish.

About the Product:
Super Saver Maida is made from fine-quality wheat. It is made from wheat grains after removing the brown covering. Maida is also known as all-purpose flour, refined flour, or simply flour. It contains fibre, vitamins, iron, magnesium, phosphorus, manganese, and selenium. It makes a perfect ingredient for baking mouth-watering desserts. You can use it extensively for making fast foods, baked goods such as pastries, bread, several varieties of sweets, and traditional flatbreads.
Storage and Uses:
Extensively used in bakery products like pastries, breads, biscuits, pizza, cookies, muffins, etc. It is also used in thickening gravies and sauces. Store in a cool and dry place.

product_USP: From 100% Ripe Tomatoes, No Added Preservatives, No Added Colour
about_the_product:
About the Product:
Tomato Puree Prepared from the pulp of hand-picked, fresh, juicy and ripe tomatoes, Dabur Hommade tomato puree is perfect for all types of cuisines. It is free of skin and seeds and helps you add the real tangy taste of tomato to your meals just within seconds. Dabur Hommade Tomato puree is made of the finest quality tomatoes sourced from Bangalore. A worthy alternative to the traditional Indian tomato puree, it is thick and consistent to add the right colour to your dishes and make them healthy and delicious. Two tablespoons of the puree are equivalent to 1 medium-sized tomato and one 200 ml Pack is equivalent to 7 (approx.) medium-sized tomatoes i. e. 450 g of raw tomatoes (appx.). Our Hommade range is an Inspiration for seasoned cooks, experimental folks who like to try cooking and aspiring chefs-to-be. This product contains no added sugars and no added preservatives. Speaking of recipes, it is great to be used in Rajma Masala, Dum Aloo, Paneer Butter Masala, Shahi Paneer, Aloo Matar, Butter Chicken Freshest ingredients always - the taste of Hommade!
How to Use:
From stews to pizzas to North Indian delicacies, this puree works wonders in your kitchen.It adds vibrant colour and a zesty taste to any cuisine, vegetarian and otherwise.Other Hommade options include ginger, garlic, ginger-garlic, and tamarind paste, as well as coconut milk, capsico, and lemoneez.

About the Product:
Idli rice is a type of rice specifically used for making idlis, a traditional South Indian steamed rice cake. Idli rice is different from regular white rice in that it undergoes a parboiling process before milling, which involves partially boiling the rice in its husk. This process helps retain more nutrients in the grain. Idli rice has a slightly coarse texture and is softer than regular rice when cooked, making it ideal for preparing soft and fluffy idlis. It is also used to make dosas (South Indian crepes) and other South Indian rice-based dishes.
How to Use:

About the Product:
Cardamom is an Indian spice known for its intense flavor and its use in traditional medicine, such as to help with digestion. Cardamom is an aromatic seed pod used in many Indian preparations such as a creamy kheer or a rich biryani. This exotic spice belongs to the ginger family. Cardamom has antimicrobial, antioxidant, and anti-inflammatory properties. It helps in protecting your heart from elevated cholesterol levels.
How to Use:
Cardamom pairs well with poultry, red meat, lentils, oranges, rice and other warm spices, like nutmeg and cinnamon.
It's ideal in curries, teas, baked goods (like this gorgeous bread) and sausages.

About the Product:
Idli rice, or idly rice, is a variety of parboiled rice popular in South Indian cuisine. It is known for its short, plump grains and is essential for making idlis, a traditional steamed rice cake. To prepare idlis, the rice is soaked, ground into a thick batter, and allowed to ferment. This batter is then steamed in moulds to create soft, fluffy idlis, which are often served with chutney or sambar.

product_desc: Palakkad Red Matta Boiled Rice - Vadi
about_the_product:
About the Product:
Palakkad Red Matta Boiled Rice is widely grown in Southern parts of India. Kerala and Karnataka are the major hubs for the cultivation of Matta rice. Various South Indian dishes like ‘idli’ and ‘appam’ are made from this rice. The matta rice is brown in colour and has a lot of health benefits. The matta rice that is not polished is called 'whole grain matta rice or 'brown rice'. All the nutrients continue to remain in the unpolished rice, while it is lost in polished rice. Polishing removes all the nutrients, leaving behind only the carbohydrates.
Ingredients:
Palakkad Red Matta Boiled Rice - Vadi
Nutritional Facts:
Calories: 350
Carbs: 80g
How to Use:
Wash matta rice at least 5 to 6 times.
Soak rice in water for at least 30 mins.

product_desc: Palakkad Red Matta Boiled Rice - Vadi
about_the_product:
About the Product:
Palakkad Red Matta Boiled Rice is widely grown in Southern parts of India. Kerala and Karnataka are the major hubs for the cultivation of Matta rice. Various South Indian dishes like ‘idli’ and ‘appam’ are made from this rice. The matta rice is brown in colour and has a lot of health benefits. The matta rice that is not polished is called 'whole grain matta rice or 'brown rice'. All the nutrients continue to remain in the unpolished rice, while it is lost in polished rice. Polishing removes all the nutrients, leaving behind only the carbohydrates.
Nutritional Facts:
Calories: 350
Carbs: 80g
Fat: 1g
Protein: 7g.
Ingredients:
Palakkad Red Matta Boiled Rice - Unda.
Storage and Uses:
Wash matta rice at least 5 to 6 times.
Soak rice in water for at least 30 mins.
Bring water to a boil. 
Add soaked rice and cook for 20 mins on medium heat stirring often. Check whether the rice is done by pressing the rice.
Once it is cooked, drain the rice. Serve.
Store in a cool and dry place 
Keep away from moisture

about_the_product:
About the Product:
Sona Masoori semi-brown rice hand-pounded refers to a variety of rice that combines characteristics of both white and brown rice. It is a semi-polished rice variety where some of the outer bran layer is retained, giving it a light brown colour and slightly nutty flavour. Hand pounding refers to the traditional method of removing the husk, which helps preserve its natural nutrients and texture.

Ready to cook.

Foxtail millet is gluten-free and rich in nutrients like protein, dietary fibre, and essential minerals such as iron and magnesium. How to Use:
Add millet, water, and tsp of oil to the pressure cooker. About the Product:
Idli Sooji Rava, also known as Idly Rava, is a type of semolina used to make a popular South Indian dish, Idli. It's a coarse powder made from rice and is different from the usual semolina or sooji used in North Indian dishes. Idli made from Idly Rava is soft, fluffy, and light, making it an ideal breakfast or snack option. This special rava is soaked in curd or yogurt and fermented overnight to create the perfect consistency for idli batter. The fermentation process also enhances the nutritional value of the dish, adding probiotics that aid digestion. Idli made from Idly Rava pairs well with a variety of chutneys, sambar, and can be enjoyed by all age groups. It's an easy-to-make, nutritious, and delicious choice for those who love South Indian cuisine.

About the Product:
Idli Sooji, also known as Idli Rava, is a core ingredient in the making of a popular South Indian dish, Idli. It is a type of semolina that is coarsely ground to a texture that is between typical Sooji (semolina) and whole rice. Idli Sooji is primarily used to prepare soft, fluffy, and melt-in-mouth idlis that are a staple breakfast item in Southern India.    Preparing Idli with Sooji is convenient as it eliminates the need for soaking, grinding, and fermenting the rice, which is the traditional method. Idli Sooji is mixed with urad dal batter to make idlis. The mixture is then steamed in moulds to achieve the characteristic round shape.    The result is a delicious, light, and spongy idli that can be served with a variety of chutneys, sambar, or even eaten plain. It's not just a breakfast item; these idlis make for a wholesome and satisfying meal any time of the day. The neutral taste of idli sooji makes it a versatile ingredient, allowing it to be flavoured according to individual preferences.

About the Product:
A perfect blend of garden-fresh aroma and natural green colour. This variety is widely used to give Indian curries its distinct curry flavour.Coriander has a flavour which combines lemon and sage, with a sweet-note as undertone. Itâ€™s a cooling spice. The Greek and the Romans thought it to be an aphrodisiac. By the third Century B.C the Romans knew it was an excellent seasoning for food. Coriander is native to the Mediterranean area. In India, Gujarat, Rajasthan, Andhra Pradesh, Tamil Nadu and Madhya Pradesh are the major producers.
How to Use:
In Indian cuisine, coriander is mainly used for taste. Frying roasted ground coriander powder in oil gives the characteristic curry flavour.

About the Product:
Cardamom, often referred to as 'Elaichi' in Hindi, is a spice native to the Indian subcontinent. It is recognized by its small seed pods, triangular in cross-section and spindle-shaped, with a thin, papery outer shell. The pods are used as flavouring agents in both food and drink, as cooking spices and as a medicine. Elaichi has a sweet, pungent taste and a strong, unique fragrance, which is why it is extensively used for culinary purposes. It lends a distinct aroma and a sweet, spicy flavour to dishes and desserts. Apart from being a versatile culinary spice, it is often used as a traditional remedy in Ayurvedic medicine for its distinct therapeutic properties. Not just the pods, even the cardamom seeds and the cardamom oil are brimming with goodness. It's a spice that is integral to Indian cuisine and is as much valued for its flavour as for its wellness benefits.

About the Product:
Vijay Thick Poha is flattened rice that has been flattened into flat, light, dry flakes. It has uneven edges and a rough texture, it doesn’t have a particular aroma and a bland gentle taste. Poha is a good source of carbohydrates, it is packed with iron, rich in fibre, a good source of antioxidants and essential vitamins and is gluten-free. A favourite for all ages. About the Product:
Byadagi Chilli Whole is celebrated for its vibrant red colour and mild heat. Unlike many other chillies, Byadagi chillies offer a subtle, smoky flavour, making them a favourite for adding depth to dishes without overpowering spiciness. Rich in vitamins A and C, these chillies are often used in Indian cuisine, especially in the preparation of traditional spice blends, sauces, and chutneys. Their distinctive wrinkled appearance adds visual appeal to any culinary creation.
How to Use:
It can be added to curries, vegetable dishes, tomato sauce, soups and stews in whole, crushed and powdered forms as required by the recipe.A powder of it can be added to marinades, and while frying onions and tomatoes for preparing curries.

About the Product:
SSP Asafoetida Powder has a strong flavor and aroma. It is extracted in the form of milk from the plant. The extraction is similar to the rubber extraction process. It is derived from a species of giant fennel and it has a unique flavor and smell. It is called for often in Indian cooking, mainly with legumes and dishes feature vegetables such as cauliflower. The odor may strike you as overpowering and somewhat unpleasant in cooking it mellows out and produces a savor similar to garlic and onion.
Ingredients:
Edible Gum, Wheat Flour, Asafoetida.
How to Use:
A pinch of it can be fried in hot oil before the rest of the ingredients are cooked.

About the Product: Broken Wheat is a coarsely ground cereal with various health benefits. Broken wheat is commonly used to make upma porridge and in desserts such as pudding. It is naturally low in gluten and has a low glycemic index. It has the highest mineral antioxidant and fiber content of any wheat flour. It is naturally rich in fiber vitamins like Vitamin B, Vitamin C, and Vitamin E, and minerals like Zinc, Calcium, Iron, Magnesium, Phosphorus, Copper, Selenium, and other nutrients such as folic acid, protein, Omega-3, and Omega-6. It is a high-protein diet but unlike meat items, it does not contain any fat and is good for a healthy lifestyle. About the Product:
Savour the wholesome goodness of bb Royal Wheat Broken Dalia. Perfectly processed to retain its natural nutrients, this versatile grain is ideal for nourishing porridge or hearty stews. Each bite offers a delightful texture and rich flavour, making every meal a satisfying and healthful experience.
How to Use:
Medium-sized wheat kernels are usually used for savoury preparations like upma or namkeen dalia.These are usually used to prepare broken wheat kheer or sweet lapsi with milk and it is used to prepare vegetable daliya and Khichdi.
Benefits:

About the Product:
Patanjali Foods Ltd Nutrela Soya Mini Chunks are made from soy flour. Soya Chunks contain immunity building nutrients, protein, iron and zinc. It is rich in dietary fiber and strengthens your immunity. It is very easy to prepare and makes tasty dishes. They are a blank canvas that you can paint on, they are odourless and tasteless by themselves. It can be used in many dishes and it is healthy and a good source of calcium. It is also a great replacement for chicken or any other meat.
How to Use:
1. Soak these soya chunks for around 10 minutes before use. 2. To soak, place in a small dish and add seasonings such as garam masala, soy sauce or balsamic vinegar, before covering with boiling water. 3. The soya chunks will expand and will then be ready to cook as if they were normal meat.

About the Product:
bb Royal Organic Cold Pressed Sesame Cooking Oil, also known as Til oil or Gingelly oil, is extracted from certified organic sesame seeds by pressing in an expeller under low-temperature conditions, known as cold pressing, resulting in a healthy and nutritious oil with a mild and pleasant flavour. Sesame oil has a slightly nutty taste, making it excellent for stir-fried dishes and salad dressings. Explore bb Royal Organics' full range of Organic Oils and Ghee to add quality and yumminess to your meals.
Benefits:
Nutritional Value: Sesame/Gingelly Cooking Oil is known for its high nutritional value. It is rich in essential fatty acids, including omega-6 fatty acids, which are beneficial for heart health and overall well-being. Antioxidant Properties: This oil is packed with antioxidants such as sesamol and sesamin, which help protect the body against oxidative stress and free radicals. These antioxidants contribute to a healthy immune system and may reduce the risk of chronic diseases. Heart Health: Sesame/Gingelly Cooking Oil is a heart-healthy choice due to its high content of monounsaturated and polyunsaturated fats. These fats help lower LDL (bad) cholesterol levels and may reduce the risk of heart disease when used as part of a balanced diet. Anti-inflammatory Effects: The oil contains compounds that have anti-inflammatory properties, which can help reduce inflammation in the body and potentially alleviate symptoms of conditions like arthritis and other inflammatory disorders. Note: BB Royal Organic Sesame Oil is free from any anti-foaming agents and hence may foam when heated. To reduce foaming, add a pea-sized piece of tamarind to the oil while heating. Foaming indicates the oil is minimally processed and pure. |
How to Use:
Cold Pressed Sesame oil is good as a condiment or as a flavouring agent for salads. It can also be added to Indian curries and gravies. Storage Information: Keep in a clean and dry place away from direct heat and sunlight. |

Note: bb Royal Organic Sesame Oil is free from any anti-foaming agents and hence may foam when heated. To reduce foaming, add a pea-sized piece of tamarind to the oil while heating. Foaming indicates the oil is minimally processed and pure.
How to Use:
Cold Pressed Sesame oil is good as a condiment or as a flavouring agent for salads. It can also be added to Indian curries and gravies. Storage Information: Keep in a clean and dry place away from direct heat and sunlight. |

About the Product:
Khus Khus, also known as Posta Dana, is a staple ingredient in many cuisines, offering a distinctive, nutty flavour. These tiny, oval-shaped seeds are derived from the poppy plant and have a creamy white appearance. While they're often used as a thickener in sauces and gravies, they're also a key ingredient in various desserts due to their rich, earthy taste. Khus Khus is commonly used in Indian cuisine, particularly in the preparation of aloo posto, a traditional Bengali dish. Its unique flavor profile lends itself well to both sweet and savoury dishes.

About the Product:
Khus Khus, also known as Posta Dana or poppy seeds, is a culinary ingredient used in various cuisines around the world. Despite their small size, these seeds carry a distinctly nutty and sweet flavor that can enhance a variety of dishes. In Indian cuisine, Khus Khus is often used as a thickening agent for gravies and as a key ingredient in certain types of desserts. It is also used to make 'posto bata', a popular dish in West Bengal. In European cuisine, it's often found in baked goods such as breads, pastries, and cakes. When ground into paste, Khus Khus releases its characteristic, aromatic flavour. The seeds are not only used for their taste, but also for their aesthetic appeal, adding a crunchy texture and a beautiful speckled appearance to dishes.

About the Product:
Bring home the wholesome goodness of nature with bb Royal Chakki Atta, fortified with Vitamin B, Iron, and Folic Acid. Made from the superior grade of wheat grains handpicked by BB experts directly sourced from the farmers. These golden amber grains go through multi-quality tests to ensure only clean grains are ground. We use the traditional chakki process with modern technology to make the finest flour, preserving the nutrients and giving you the perfect balance of colour, taste, and nutrition. bb Fortified Royal Chakki Atta is a complete nourishment package for your entire family, fulfilling your daily required intake of essential vitamins and minerals without you taking note of it. Micronutrients-infused fortified whole wheat flour contains Vitamin B12, Folic Acid, and Iron, which prevent malnourishment. Folic Acid is known for preventing deformities in children and promoting the growth and development of a healthy body. Fortification increases the nutrient value of flour and helps to cover up the micronutrient (i.e. vitamin and mineral) requirements for the larger section of the population. bb Royal Fortified Atta range has been created for public health, with research and vision to reduce nutrition-related deficiency in India. To ensure you get 100% pure and nutritious atta, we do not mix an ounce of Maida with our product. Whether your rotis are round or not, we promise your rotis will be highly nutritious and soft. Serve your family wholesome goodness with bb Royal Chakki Atta. We endeavour to give you the best quality flour and the best price to our farmers. With the elimination of middlemen, bb Team has been ensuring for the last 3 years that our farmers/ FPOs get a fair remunerative price for their produce than what farmers get in Mandis.
Features:
Fortified Atta with essential micronutrients like Vitamin B12, Iron, and Folic Acid. Ground via traditional stone chakki with a modern process that preserves nutrition. 100% whole wheat and 0% added Maida or preservatives. Sourced directly to farmers that help them earn better as there is no middlemen in between. Gives you soft rotis. Atta processing centres are certified for Food Safety Management system ISO 22000 to monitor and verify the quality systems. 100% clean & hygienic wheat is used for making flour after going through multi-stage quality tests. Wheat is sourced at the time of harvest & the same wheat is stored in warehouses under the supervision of BB QA team to maintain consistent quality throughout the year. Strict guidelines are followed while cleaning, processing, & packaging, which is completely automated for hygiene & superior quality.

About the Product:
Flax seeds, also known as Alsi, are small, shiny and flat in appearance that can be added to any of your foods.
These are a tiny storehouse of vital nutrients.
True Elements Flax Seeds are high-quality, natural seeds derived from organically grown plants.
They act as a healthy protector and are an outstanding source of protein and fiber.
Small, shiny and flat with a slightly pointed shape, these tiny seeds can become your go-to snack and can be consumed in any way, adding a nutritional punch to your diet.

About the Product:
Aashirvaad ensures that only superior quality ingredients reach your kitchen, and Aashirvaad Chilli Powder stays true to that promise. Aashirvaad Chilli Powder has been lovingly made in India using a 4-step advantage process to ensure that only a high-quality product reaches your kitchen. With a wide network of farmers, Aashirvaad sources chillies directly from the farmers. The chillies are then carefully selected by experts. These chosen crisp chillies are then traditionally sun-dried and thoroughly cleaned, ensuring that the chilli powder is perfectly balanced in colour and taste. The automated packaging and processing, with zero human intervention, ensures purity in every pack. With no added flavours and colours, Aashirvaad Chilli Powder is so potent that even a tiny quantity enhances the colour and taste of the dish. So add a pinch of this chilli powder to bring alive the colour and spiciness of your preparation!

Aashirvaad Chilli Powder is made using the 4-step advantage process to ensure a high-quality chilli powder The chillies for Aashirvaad Chilli Powder are sourced directly from the farms Selected by experts, then traditionally sun-dried and thoroughly cleaned, Aashirvaad Chilli Powder is perfectly balanced in colour and taste The automated packaging and processing ensure that the chilli powder remains safe This pure and natural chilli powder brings alive the authentic taste and colour of traditional cooking

About the Product:

About the Product:
Little millet has a mild, nutty flavour and a slightly chewy texture when cooked. It is highly nutritious, and rich in dietary fibre, minerals, and essential nutrients. Little millet is versatile and can be used in various dishes such as porridge, upma (a South Indian dish), salads, and as a substitute for rice in pilafs. It is valued for its health benefits and culinary versatility.
How to Use:
Take 1 cup samai (little millet), required salt and 2.5 cups of water in a pressure cooker and cook for 2 whistles.Let the pressure go down by itself. Then serve hot.

About the Product:
Desiccated coconut powder is a finely grated, dried form of coconut meat. It is made by grating the white, edible part of the coconut kernel, then drying it to remove moisture. Desiccated coconut powder is commonly used in baking, confectionery, and cooking to impart a rich coconut flavour and texture to various dishes. It is a versatile ingredient and can be used in cakes, cookies, curries, desserts, and toppings for salads and smoothies.
How to Use:
It can be added to hot or cold cereals and as an addition to baked goods. Also consumed as a snack item.This can be added in smoothies, sprinkling on salads or stirred into sautÃ©ed vegetables.

About the Product:
Discover the exceptional quality of our Ponni Raw Rice, aged for over 12 months to enhance its flavour and texture. Known for its aromatic fragrance and long, slender grains, this rice is perfect for a variety of dishes, from biryanis to everyday meals. The aging process allows the rice to absorb more water, resulting in a fluffier, more distinct grain upon cooking. Ideal for those who appreciate high-quality, traditional rice, Ponni Raw Rice brings a touch of authenticity to your culinary creations. Elevate your meals with the rich taste and superior quality of aged Ponni Raw Rice.
How to Use:
Gently wash the rice with drinking water. Soak it in water for 2-3 minutes. For better cooking results, soak for 30 minutes prior to cooking. Drain the water and add flakes to the pan.Electric Cooker: Add 1 cup of rice to 2.0 cups of water and place it in an electric cooker, switch it on and wait for approximately 20 to 25 minutes. Allow it to cool for a few minutes and take out the rice to serve. Pressure Cooker: Add 1 cup of rice to 2.0 cups of water either directly in a pressure cooker or in compartment vessels, close the pressure cooker properly, put the whistle weight and keep the cooker on medium flame. Switch off the flame once 3 whistles are completed. Allow it to cool till the pressure in the cooker comes down completely, remove the weight and open the cooker to take out the rice to serve. Note: Water ratio may vary slightly for open cookware cooking when compared to pressure cooking. Water ratio may vary based on the texture of rice you desire to have, like firm, soft, or sticky. \n

About the Product:
A staple in the Indian diet, Urad Dal Split provides nutrients such as protein and fibre. Made of select grains and recommended by Chef Sanjeev Kapoor and Chef Ranveer Brar, Tata Sampann Unpolished Urad Dal makes for a delicious meal choice. So whenever you are in the mood to cook something easy and delicious, dive into the scrumptious taste of Tata Sampann pulses and enjoy a lovely meal!
How to Use:
Boil 3-4 cups of Urad dal in the cooker and pressurise for 2 whistles. Grind and keep 2 medium tomatoes, 2 tsp of coriander powder, some red chillies, a small piece of ginger, cumin seeds or powder, and garam masala. Melt 100g butter in a pan and fry 3 sliced onions with cardamom, cinnamon, and cloves. Add the ground masala and fry for 15-20 mins. Add the boiled Urad dal and add water to make the gravy. |

product_desc: Palakkad Red Matta Boiled Rice - Unda
about_the_product:
About the Product:
Palakkad Red Matta Boiled Rice is widely grown in Southern parts of India. Kerala and Karnataka are the major hubs for the cultivation of Matta rice. Various South Indian dishes like ‘idli’ and ‘appam’ are made from this rice. The matta rice is brown in colour and has a lot of health benefits. The matta rice that is not polished is called 'whole grain matta rice or 'brown rice'. All the nutrients continue to remain in the unpolished rice, while it is lost in polished rice. Polishing removes all the nutrients, leaving behind only the carbohydrates.
Ingredients:
Palakkad Red Matta Boiled Rice - Unda
Nutritional Facts:
Calories: 350
Carbs: 80g
How to Use:
Wash matta rice at least 5 to 6 times.
Soak rice in water for at least 30 mins.

product_desc: Palakkad Red Matta Boiled Rice - Unda
about_the_product:
About the Product:
Palakkad Red Matta Boiled Rice is widely grown in Southern parts of India. Kerala and Karnataka are the major hubs for the cultivation of Matta rice. Various South Indian dishes like ‘idli’ and ‘appam’ are made from this rice. The matta rice is brown in colour and has a lot of health benefits. The matta rice that is not polished is called 'whole grain matta rice or 'brown rice'. All the nutrients continue to remain in the unpolished rice, while it is lost in polished rice. Polishing removes all the nutrients, leaving behind only the carbohydrates.
Nutritional Facts:
Calories: 349
Carbs: 77g
Fat: 0g
Protein: 9g
Ingredients:
Usna Rice - Boiled.
Storage and Uses:
1. Wash matta rice at least 5 to 6 times. 2. Soak rice in water for at least 30 mins. 3. Bring water to a boil. 4. Add soaked rice and cook for 20 mins on medium heat stirring often. Check whether the rice is done by pressing the rice. 5. Once it is cooked, drain the rice. Serve.
1. Store in a cool and dry place 2. Keep away from moisture

They also contain a good range of nutrients, including iron, calcium, B2, folate and beta-carotene, which the body converts into vitamin A.

About the Product:
Split cashew nuts, also known as kaju, are pieces of whole cashew nuts that have been split during processing. Despite their irregular shape, they retain the same creamy texture and rich, buttery flavour as whole cashews. These Split pieces are ideal for use in cooking, baking, and garnishing, adding a delightful crunch and flavour to various dishes. They are commonly used in Indian cuisine, desserts, and snack mixes, offering a versatile and cost-effective option for culinary use.
How to Use:
It can be used in candy bars, sweets and pastry.Splits are crisper than wholes and sometimes preferred for that reason.

About the Product:
Sesame is an important ingredient in cooking. It gives a rich delicate nutty flavour. Almost invisible crunch to your dishes. Sesame seeds are excellent sources of copper. A very good source of manganese calcium, phosphorus magnesium, iron, zinc, molybdenum, vitamin B1 & selenium. Although much of its calorie comes from fats, sesame contains several notable health-benefiting nutrients, minerals, antioxidants and vitamins. The seeds are especially rich in mono-unsaturated fatty acid, oleic acid, which comprises up to 50 percent of fatty acids in them. Oleic acid helps lower LDL or "bad cholesterol" and increases HDL or "good cholesterol" in the blood. The seeds are also very valuable sources of dietary protein with fine quality amino acids that are essential for growth, especially in children.

Protein: 22 g.

Lightly toasted til are often used whole to sprinkle on bread or salads.
Tandoori flatbreads like naan and kulchas are incomplete without the sesame seeds.
Sesame seeds can be used for sweet and savory dishes.

SautÃ© on medium heat until the onion is translucent. Then add the cubed potatoes or green peas if using. Stir well. Sprinkle turmeric and salt. Stir and cook for a few seconds. Fennel seeds, commonly known as Saunf, are aromatic and flavourful seeds derived from the fennel plant. About the Product:
Popcorn is a healthy and popular snack. Although there are several flavours available, the original popcorn kernels are the best for your health. Popcorn, or popcorn, is a variety of corn kernel, which expands and puffs up when heated. A popcorn kernel's strong hull contains the seed's hard, starchy endosperm with 14-20 % moisture, which turns to steam as the kernel is heated. The best thing about this snack is that it is oil-free and is easy to make.
Benefits:
Popcorn also is a reliable source of polyphenols, which are antioxidants that have been linked to better blood circulation and digestive health, as well as a potentially lower risk of certain cancers.
Another health benefit of popcorn is its high satiety.
Because of popcorn's high fibre content, low-calorie count and its low energy density, popcorn is a food that can aid in weight loss.
Nutritional Facts:
Calories: 382,
Carbs: 78 g,
Fat: 4 g,
Protein: 12 g.
How to Use:
It can be eaten salted, dry roasted, boiled and even raw.
It can be used to make peanut butter.
Sprinkle peanuts onto tossed salads.
Add peanuts to healthy sautéed chicken and vegetables and added to Indian gravies.

About the Product:
Vijay Medium Poha is flattened rice that has been flattened into flat, light, dry flakes. It has uneven edges and a rough texture, it doesn’t have a particular aroma and a bland gentle taste. You can give it any flavour and taste depending on the cooking method. It is a classic light and tasty breakfast staple that is loved by everyone. Poha is a good source of carbohydrates, it is packed with iron, rich in fibre, a good source of antioxidants and essential vitamins and is gluten-free. A favourite for all ages. Made of the best quality organic rice. Flattened rice, which is easily digestible. No cholesterol and trans fat.
Ingredients:
Flattened  Rice
Nutritional Facts:
Energy: 356.70kcal
Protein: 8.05g
Carbohydrates: 79.03g
Fat: 0.94g
Dietary fibre: 8.05g
Storage and Uses:
1. It is used to make various dishes like chivda, upma, dosa, idli and many more.
2. Store in cool and dry hygienic place.
3. Keep away from sunlight.

About the Product:
Everest Garam Masala has been a perennial taste enhancer for several years in India. A select blend of 13 spices go into this grand old universal taste enhancer. Being chilli based, it provides an exotic red gravy to dishes. It is widely used all over India on account of its being a less pungent garam masala. Fennel, Tejpatta (Cinnamon leaves) and Trifala imparts a cooling effect to this blend. It is used essentially for preparing vegetarian dishes requiring a gravy. Gujaratis and Marwaris normally use it in lentils (dal) and for filling in snacks such as samosa, usal, patra, farsan etc.

About the Product:
Bring home the most nutritious flour with bb Royal’s trust and the same taste. The fortified Multigrain Atta is made from 9 powerful grains and millets, including Horse Gram, Amaranthus, Bajra, Barley, Ragi, Jowar, Soybean, Bengal gram, and maize. BB experts directly source these grains and millets from the farmers of Madhya Pradesh and Karnataka. Then, the selected grains & millets go through multi-quality tests to ensure only clean grains are ground into the most nutritious flour for you. bb Royal Fortified Multigrain Atta is a complete nourishment package for your entire family. Whether you are working on weight management or struggling to add more nutrition to your family’s plate, this atta is best for you. It fulfils your daily required intake of essential vitamins and minerals without you taking note of it. Micronutrients-infused Fortified Multigrain flour contains Vitamin B12, Folic Acid, and Iron that prevent malnourishment. Folic Acid is known for preventing deformities in children and promoting the growth and development of a healthy body. Fortification increases the nutrient value of flour and helps to cover up the micronutrient’s i.e. vitamin and mineral requirements for the larger section of the population. bb Royal Fortified Atta range has been created for public health with research & vision to reduce nutrition-related deficiency in India. To ensure you get 100% pure and nutritious atta, we do not mix an ounce of Maida with our product. Whether your rotis are round or not, we promise your rotis will be highly nutritious and soft. Serve your family wholesome goodness with bb Royal Chakki Atta. We endeavour to give you the best quality flour and the best price to our farmers. With the elimination of middlemen, BB Team has been ensuring for the last 3 years that our farmers/ FPOs get a fair remunerative price for their produce than what farmers get in Mandis.
Features:
Made with Wheat & 9 other whole grains, including horse gram, amaranthus, bajra, barley, ragi, jowar, soybean, Bengal gram, and maize. Fortified Atta with essential micronutrients like Vitamin B12, Iron, and Folic Acid. Processed with CSIR – CFTRI technology. Sourced directly to farmers that help them earn better as there are no middlemen in between. Gives you soft rotis. Can be used to make a variety of Rotis, Pulkas, Parathas, chapatis. Atta processing centres are certified for Food Safety Management system ISO 22000 to monitor and verify the quality systems. 100% clean & hygienic wheat is used for making flour after going through multi-stage quality tests. Wheat is sourced at the time of harvest & the same wheat is stored in warehouses under the supervision of BB QA team to maintain consistent quality throughout the year. Strict guidelines are followed while cleaning, processing, & packaging, which is completely automated for hygiene & superior quality.

About the Product:
Maggi Masala-ae-Magic is a magical and secret ingredient for those who cook daily as it enhances the taste of everyday food and makes them extraordinarily tasty. This perfect blend of the 10 choicest aromatic and roasted spices is a great cooking aid to mothers anywhere as it adds that flavorful taste and aroma to your everyday dishes loved by kids. Maggi Masala-ae-Magic Share Bag contains 12 single-serve sachets that can be used for a variety of everyday dishes that range from vegetables like Aloo Gobi, Bhindi, Dal, Paneer, etc. to pasta, biryani, and many more.
Features:
Maggi Masala-ae-Magic is a perfect blend of ten choicest aromatic and roasted spices. It is the secret ingredient that makes your everyday vegetables extraordinarily tasty. Now your kids will fall in love with everyday vegetables. Use in a variety of dishes like Sabzi, Dal, Paneer, Pasta, and more. Each serve (2g) provides 15% of your daily requirement of Vitamin A, Iron, and Iodine.
How to Use:
Cook your dish as you normally do. Sprinkle a sachet of Maggi Masala-ae-Magic towards the last 2 to 3 minutes of your cooking. Give it a stir and your extraordinary dish is ready.

About the Product:
Ponni Raw Rice is medium-grain rice that is lightweight and sweet-smelling and is measured to be of the finest quality. It has a distinctive taste that is not matched by rice from any other region. It is the tastiest of all the Ponni Raw Rice available in the state.
Ingredients:
Ponni Raw Rice
Nutritional Facts:
Calories: 160
Fat: 0 g
Protein: 3 g
How to Use:
Gently wash the rice with drinking water. Soak it in water for 2-3 minutes. For better cooking results soak 30 minutes prior to cooking. Drain the water and add flakes to the pan.
Electric Cooker: Add 1 cup of rice to 2.0 cups of water and place it in an electric cooker, switch it on, and wait for approximately 20 to 25 minutes. Allow it to cool for a few minutes and take out the rice to serve.
Pressure Cooker: Add 1 cup of rice to 2.0 cups of water either directly in a pressure cooker or in compartment vessels, close the pressure cooker properly, put whistle weight and keep the cooker on medium flame. Switch off the flame once 3 whistles are completed. Allow it to cool till the pressure in the cooker comes down completely, remove the weight and open the cooker to take out the rice to serve.
Note: Water ratio may vary slightly for open cookware cooking when compared to pressure cooking. Water ratio may vary based on the texture of rice you deserve to have like a firm, soft, sticky.

about_the_product:
About the Product:
Today, our food habits, stress, and low activity levels affect our health, and without realising it, our heart health too. A healthy heart is among the first steps to overall health. So, it is not about taking care when a problem arises, but ensuring you take small steps today to take proactive care of your heart and health. The easiest step is to switch to heart-healthy foods, and choosing the right cooking oil can help make your meals better for your heart health. New Saffola Gold blended edible oil can help keep your family heart healthy. It helps keep your cholesterol in check^. This vegetable oil's dual seed technology gives you the goodness of two oils in one - rice bran oil and sunflower oil, ensuring a good balance of MUFA and PUFA for better nutrition from fats compared to single seed oils. It also has the benefit of antioxidants that help fight free radicals. New Saffola Gold has Oryzanol that helps maintain healthy cholesterol levels. New Saffola Gold cooking oil comes with LOSORBÃ¢â€žÂ¢ technology, which ensures that your food absorbs up to 33%* less oil. So, choose Saffola Gold as a smart way to keep your heart healthy! ^Helps manage cholesterol better than commonly consumed oils based on a randomized double-blind clinical study 2019, as approved by the independent ethics committee. Saffola encourages you to use less oil, exercise regularly, and have a balanced lifestyle. *As compared to commonly consumed cooking oils; basis frying studies on potato 2019.
Features:
Saffola GoldÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Dual Seed Technology with the goodness of two oils in one - rice bran oil and sunflower oil ensures a good balance of MUFA PUFA for better nutrition through fats compared to single seed oils. Get the power of immunity every day with natural antioxidants in Saffola Gold that help build immunity. Saffola Gold blended edible oil helps keep your cholesterol in check. Oryzanol helps maintain healthy cholesterol levels. With LOSORBÃ¢â€žÂ¢ Technology that ensures your food absorbs up to 33%^ less oil as compared to other commonly consumed cooking oils, basis frying studies on potato 2019. This vegetable oil brings alive the natural flavour of the food cooked & spices used without altering any flavour.

About the Product:
Raw rice is grown without the usage of any chemical pesticides and hence has great taste and aroma. It has an excellent source of protein and is high in nutrients. It is finely processed to remove foreign grains, husk, dust particles and other impurities. It is free from all artificial colours and harmful adulterants. It is a delicious taste and has a fine texture.
Nutritional Facts:
Calories: 210
Carbs: 43 g
Fat: 1 g
Protein: 7 g
Benefits:
High fibre
Gluten-free
Low glycemic index, thereby lowering the impact of raised blood sugar
Lowers cholesterol
How to Use:
Ponni rice should typically be prepared with double the quantity of water.
One cup of rice should be added to at least two cups of boiling water.
Once it is cooked, it should be covered and left to stand before it is drained.

About the Product:
Enjoy the superior quality of Ponni Raw Rice, aged for over 6 months to enhance its natural aroma and texture. This rice is known for its medium-sized grains and subtle fragrance, making it a perfect choice for a variety of dishes, from everyday meals to special recipes. The aging process ensures a fluffier and more distinct grain when cooked.
How to Use:
Gently wash the rice with drinking water. Soak it in water for 2-3 minutes. For better cooking results, soak for 30 minutes prior to cooking. Drain the water and add flakes to the pan. Electric Cooker: Add 1 cup of rice to 2.0 cups of water and place it in an electric cooker, switch it on and wait for approximately 20 to 25 minutes. Allow it to cool for a few minutes and take out the rice to serve. Pressure Cooker: Add 1 cup of rice to 2.0 cups of water either directly in a pressure cooker or in compartment vessels, close the pressure cooker properly, put the whistle weight and keep the cooker on medium flame. Switch off the flame once 3 whistles are completed. Allow it to cool till the pressure in the cooker comes down completely, remove the weight and open the cooker to take out the rice to serve. Note: Water ratio may vary slightly for open cookware cooking when compared to pressure cooking. The water ratio may vary based on the texture of the rice you desire to have, like firm, soft, or sticky.

About the Product:
Thick Poha is smaller in size, prepared by flattening the dehusked rice. It gets its thick texture and rectangular shape from less beating. It is highly nutritious and enriched with Vitamins A & C, calcium, and carbohydrates. It’s easy to digest, soft to chew and takes little time in cooking. It gives good energy as it contains low saturated fat which does not affect your cholesterol levels. It's an Ideal breakfast cereal for adults, senior citizens, and kids. It is a healthy snack because it is lactose, cholesterol, sodium and fat-free. Thick poha is preferred for making traditional poha dishes like Kanda Poha, aloo poha as it does not stick when soaked in water. It can also be used with Milk and Sugar or Cooked to Create Poha, Desserts, Upma. It Can Also Be Fried to Create Delicious Snacks.Your Favourite Poha/Avalakki/Aval/Chivda now comes with Bb Royal's trust, sourced from the finest farm and prepared in hygienic and qualitative packaging to ensure safe transits.Click here for unique and delicious recipes -https://www.bigbasket.com/flavors/collections/233/rice-rice-products/
How to Use:
Soak it in water for 2-3 minutes.Drain the water and add flakes to the pan. It can be fried with spices and chilly to make a hot and tasty dish or it can also be mixed with milk and sugar to make sweet preparation.
Benefits:
It contains a good amount of complex carbohydrates and dietary fiber.It is also a rich source of vitamin E and minerals such as calcium, iron and magnesium.It is easily digestible and filling making it light yet satisfying meals.Poha is light on the stomach and easy to digest.It is a source of instant energy on account of the rice content.

About the Product:

Oleev Active is an everyday cooking oil with the goodness of olive oil and is the perfect choice for all types of cooking.

Linoleic Acid in Oleev Active yields large quantities of ATP, which is the high energy molecule that provides energy for you to stay active and energized throughout the day.

About the Product:
Coriander or Dhaniya powder is a must has spices ingredient in all Indian Households. Ranging from the North to the South of India, Dhaniya sees itself as part of all kinds of Indian cuisines, whether it is a simple daily meal or an exotic one. Having it in a powder form is a cook's delight as it is made from the finest coriander seeds. Our experts select the best to ensure you get coriander powder that is perfectly balanced in aroma and flavour. To source the coriander we go directly to the farmers.
Nutritional Facts:
Calories: 15,
Carbs: 3 g,
Fat: 1 g,
Protein: 1 g.
How to Use:
These seeds are used in curry powder, curries, sausages, pickles, stews and sauces.
Add coriander to your pepper grinder. Mix white peppercorns with some coriander seed. It will give your pepper a nice mildness and tastes great on vegetables and eggs.
Benefits:
Coriander is anti-bacterial, anti-microbial and anti-inflammatory in nature.
Consuming dhania dal after meals can have many medicinal benefits.
Dhania Dal is made by roasting whole coriander seeds and then adding a pinch of salt.
It is most commonly eaten as a mouth freshener / after mint.

About the Product:
Aashirvaad Bansi Rava also known as Broken Wheat is a cereal food made from cracked parboiled groats of wheat. It contains natural proteins, vitamins and minerals. It makes perfect food for breakfast. This provides a wholesome meal to your entire family. It is slightly nutty and chewy, has a hearty, warm aroma and has a delightful, grainy taste when cooked. This is often used to make soups and to stuff vegetables. It does not contain any added preservatives or added flavour.

About the ProductStay in the pink of your health with GoodDiet Himalayan Pink Rock Salt. This salt comes in the form of tiny crystals, found naturally in the Himalayas and contains magnesium, potassium, required sodium, and 84 other traces of minerals that are not present in common salt. Low in sodium and high in flavor, a tiny amount of pink salt can go a long way in enhancing your dishes.
As the core ingredient, Pink Salt plays two roles - It reduces bitter flavours and makes the rest of the flavour pop and also helps to balance the pH levels in the body, flushes out toxins, keeps you hydrated at all times and improves your energy. Your table salt also undergoes a refining process that removes its impurities and any other mineral besides sodium chloride. However, BB GoodDiet's Himalayan Rock Salt comes with its own health benefits.

Natural Rock Salt.

Helps to improve respiratory diseases.
Balances your body's pH 3.
Help reduce signs of aging.
Helps regulate blood sugar levels.
Helps improve the quality of sleep An easy replacement option for your table salt that is suitable for people of all age groups. It is very much similar to black salt powder. It provides necessary nourishment and brings purity & taste to the table to enjoy.
How to Use:
Open the pack and add BB GoodDiet's Himalayan Pink Rock Salt (powder) to the dish according to your choice of taste.

From the Brand:
About the Product
These roasted pistachio nuts with a distinct nutty flavor are an enjoyment.
Pistachios are rich in fiber and protein, both of which help in keeping you energetic all day.
They're also very low-calorie nuts, hence, can be snacked on guilt-free.

Sprinkle pistachio on a salad or in a stir fry.
Crushed pistachios can be used as a paste and added in many recipes.
The toasted and salted pistachios are usually enjoyed as a snack.

About the ProductBB Gooddiet brings you the healthier version of your regular Sugar. BB Gooddiet Low Glycemic Index Natural Cane sugar was developed using proprietary, plant-based technology to significantly reduce the cane sugar’s glycemic index while maintaining its physical properties and sweetness.
Regular sugar usually increases your blood sugar level after consumption due to its high GI Value(65), whereas BB Gooddiet with low Gi sugar has attained a GI value of (43), with its natural herb extracts which control the release of sugar levels in your blood. BB Gooddiet with low GI sugar is 100% natural without any artificial taste, sweetener or stevia. BB Gooddiet with low GI sugar can be used in all dishes and sweets.

Cane Sugar With The Extracts Of Cinnamon, Jamun Seeds, Tinospora Cordifolia, Banaba Leaves And Flax Seeds.

It can be used as a direct replacement for regular sugar.

About the Product:
Palakkad Red Matta Boiled Rice is a traditional variety of rice known for its unique flavour and distinctive red hue. Cultivated in the Palakkad region, it undergoes a parboiling process that retains its natural nutrients. The grains are thick and robust, making it a perfect choice for various Indian dishes. This rice is cherished for its rich texture and aromatic quality, making it a staple in many households.
Storage and Uses:
Wash matta rice at least 5 to 6 times.Soak rice in water for at least 30 mins.Bring water to a boil.Add soaked rice and cook for 20 mins on medium heat stirring often. Check whether the rice is done by pressing the rice.Once it is cooked, drain the rice. Serve.Store in a cool and dry placeKeep away from moisture
